data.title: Great Place to See a Blues Hocky Game
data.text: I attended a NHL hockey game, and had a great time! Seating was good viewing from all areas of the arena, and the access was easy. Find a parking meter within 2-3 blocks about an hour before the event, if the event is for the evening, as meters are no longer in force after 7:00 PM, and you only have to pay for the time remaining until that time. And you can pay with a card if you don't have coins!

data.title: Great Venue
data.text: A bit outdated but a great venue. Went to see my first ever ice hockey game.  It was very good well worth the ticket price and St Louis Blues won all in all a great evening superb seats great view

data.title: Let's Go Blues!
data.text: We sat in section 111 in seats 8-9, so we had pretty good seats.  We were able to see all the action happening on the ice. The venue is pretty descent, but I'm not sure why the price for concessions is outrageous. We will eat before we come again. I give the Blues 5 stars, and Scott Trade 2-3 stars.

data.title: 50th season home opener
data.text:
We've loved our Blues in St. Lou for 50 years now. The product on the ice always deserves our admiration. The buildings they've played competitive NHL hockey in not so much but we loved the "character" of the "Old Barn" (Arena) on Oakland until 1999. The Scot Rade is now showing its age and the franchise deserves some more city help to keep it current.
Operation of it during games is up to the organization. We were very disappointed that they made all of us fans use only 1 escalator Thursday night to leave after a well deserved home opener victory. Can't believe this mistake but here is a photo. This was on the Clark St. side. We deserve better than to waste our time. I hope you're listening. Hope the Blues earn the Cup they deserve in 2017/2018 with us by them.

data.title: Blues
data.text: Saw the Blues game last night. Great seats as we sat in row EE section 108. Nice sight lines all away around.

data.title: Kids Hockey Weekend
data.text:
Scott Trade is in need of a facelife (not a new building just a facelift).  22 yr old...very surprised they did not do something more for the 50th anniversary of the BLUES.  New hallway flooring; new graphics; new seats.

Food ridiculous. ...poor quality; $$$$
Wine $8.50; Beer $9.50 (2 beers = a case??); horrible hot dog $5.50 (=10 at the grocery store).  Horrible service...slow; took 3 to determine the cost??? What if thus was a Blues play off.  Come on folks St Louis can do better.

data.title: Not just for the Blues
data.text: This venue has been used for various sports and shows.  The Missouri Valley Basketball Tournament is a popular event in March each year.  The fans are amazing!

data.title: Free Tickets to a concert
data.text: The venue was nice and load for a concert.  it was clean and well kept, I felt very safe there.  there were lots of food and liquor vendors.

data.title: Twenty One Pilots – Emotional Roadshow Concert
data.text: Had never been to the Scottrade Center. Was a very good venue for this concert. Found parking within a block cheap, $5 on second level of a parking lot. Friendly staff working at the center. Highly recommend seeing the band anywhere. Great, great show.

data.title: Coldplay, Head Full of Dreams Tour
data.text:
If Coldplay is a band you like then you will love their current show. The Head Full of Dreams Tour was at the Scottrade Center on the night of the 21st of July. It was a great night of music and technology, a must see for a fan of their music. When you walk in and get your ticket scanned you are given a LED bracelet that makes you and everyone at the show part of the lighting. 
I don't go to any of the Blues hockey games, but I did feel like I was skating, the floors are very slick with what I hope is just popcorn butter. I watched a few men in the tiled floor restroom almost hit the deck. I know it was like 104 degrees that day in St. Louis, and inside the Scottrade Center it was about 90 degrees, they would not have been able to make ice that night.
All in all it was a great night, if Coldplay is within traveling distance go see them, you won't be sorry.

data.title: Coldplay
data.text: Venue was not staffed properly for huge crowds. Poor AC, Poor food options, Poor Premium Seating area.  Needs renovation! However, Coldplay was fantastic!

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: Amazing and great.  Concerts and sports are good to have there.  Especially the sports.  Hockey is great along with basketball.  Amazing how fast the floor can be turned into a concert hall in hours and than back to hockey.

data.title: saw coldplay here, amazing!!!!
data.text: didn't feel like an overwhelming or cold venue, very easy to locate seats, clean, expensive drinks but hey what else do you expect? Seemed like every seat had a good view!!

data.title: Great experience for a concert
data.text: We went to a Selena Gomez concert.  It is within walking distance from the Union Station Double Tree Hilton.  The layout is similar to other concert venues.  I walked around some and it seemed all seats provided good views of the stage.

data.title: Good venue
data.text: Scottrade Center is a good venue for concerts.  The only issue we encountered was a long line trying to get in.

data.title: See an NHL game at a budget price
data.text: I was in the area for a business trip and caught a game with several colleagues.  The tickets were very reasonably priced, less than $20, in the nosebleed section...but there didn't appear to be a bad seat in the house.  I would go again.

data.title: WWE Monday Night Raw
data.text: Always great places to sit and usually a good view from everywhere. Vending is rather expensive especially when you have kids but it's like that everywhere nowadays.  Restrooms are large and convenient. Easy in and easy out access. Parking is also good. Only reason I give a 4 is concessions pricing.

data.title: Good arena for events
data.text: I am a hockey fan, so enjoy watching the Blues play here. It's also used for Guns v. Hoses (police v. fire dept) boxing, various ice events, March madness basketball, a venue for music events, I am always checking out the calendar to see what is coming next

data.title: Blues lose
data.text: Was a great night. Came to watch the Sharks/Blues playoff game. Sat behind penalty box on the glass. Old worn out stadium that's in need of a big renovation but had a great time. Fans were a lot of fun, seats came with free food and booze can't beat it.

data.title: Blues season ticket holders and executives beware!!
data.text: If you're looking for an organization that you can expect high quality service for season ticket holders, business executives, groups, high-end clients who expect not only quality service, but also discretion, avoid St. Blues Blues Ticketing Management.  Always thrilled with Scottrade Center staff and management for every other department - but Blues ticketing management (Tim) is not representative of the high standards of the Blues, Concert, and Other Event teams/management.
